result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Daron Caffey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $159.00 to The Buckle. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $30 per month with the first payment due on 10/01/15 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter. Restitution to be paid first. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due forthwith and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Huber privileges for work and work search.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Daron Caffey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.
CLARIFICATION to sentencing entry of 6-30-2015.  Defendant has 83 days total of credit for time served.

Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
As to Count 1:  Court sentences defendant to serve 40 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 40 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
As to Count 2:  Court sentences defendant to serve 3 months  in the House of Correction with credit for 43 days, Huber privileges for work and work search. 

Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $159.00 to The Buckle. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $30 per month with the first payment due on 10-01-2015 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  Restitution to be paid first. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Antonio Daron Caffey not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel has jury duty and requests an adjourned sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 2:   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing.   Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Antonio Daron Caffey not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Case in court with 14CM5178.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Br 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Antonio Daron Caffey not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Case in court with 14CM5178. State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense counsel requests to schedule both cases for projected guilty plea.  Court denies request and orders the 06-02-2015 jury trial date for 14CM5178 remains.  Court orders case adjourned for status on same date.  Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Mayfair Mall
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Antonio Daron Caffey in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Daron Caffey
Current: 3131 N 5th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 04-29-2015)
Prior: 2320 West Clarke Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
